job_title: First Choice RN in Fort Lauderdale, FL
pros: $55/hour as a nurse in Florida. Make your own schedule as you go. You can literally call the day before and schedule yourself for shifts as you go, or you can make it out further if you want. I was never told no for a shift I wanted.
cons: First Choice is float pool. No benefits because you are per diem. Some of the charge nurses, nurses, and PCAs are mean/rude depending on which unit you're floating to that day. Religious "faith-based" organization, and it is mentioned and talked about very often.

job_title: Medical Assistant in Fort Lauderdale, FL
pros: Some great physicians who still care and value their patients. Gym on site.
cons: Administration is a complete joke. Patrick Taylor CEO is lazy and uninterested in anyone other than him. Management is horrible. The food is horrible, actually found a maggot in my food once. 30 cent raise max which occurs once a year, and then they pull the "well at least you have a job line".  Insurance is ridiculous. They make it so you have no choice but to see only Holy Cross Physicians so that way they get their money back with the out of this planet copays. Hardly any room for growth. High expectations and yet no allowed overtime. Actually you will probably get flexed, and then they will dock your PTO to bring you up to 40 hours. Which when you actually want to take vacation you cant.

job_title: Pharmacy Technician in Fort Lauderdale, FL
pros: I like my actual work that I do as a technician
cons: Feel that standards of competency, workload are not upheld. Some work as little as possible but still get same pay/benefits as others who tow the line. Forget praise, I need other incentive to keep working so hard when other slack and skate by. Also, the general staff are not included as much as could be about problem solving, policy change. Idiotic changes are made that seem not to make any sense on the worker level.

job_title: Physician Account Liaison II in Coral Springs, FL
pros: Great work atmosphere and every person that works there seems to be very nice, Dr Taylor is very involved with the staff and there is a great deal of transparency between the senior management and other staff
cons: older campus and located in a very transient area as quoted by the safety director, use caution at all times in the parking lot and notify security of anytime strange

job_title: Registered Nurse in Fort Lauderdale, FL
pros: The only pro is that its a magnet hospital.
cons: Management leaves much to be desired. My core values and those of Holy Cross clashed (which is why i resigned ). They Nurse to percentages, KPI, and allowing employees to work while sick. I prefer to nurse people, when they need me and for however long it takes.  I do not believe in working sick because of infection control. Holy Cross doesnt give a Holy Crap about your personal health nor your family's. Sorry Holy... Me and my family come first, then the patient,  then the who do's you call Managers.

review_title: You will be worked like a slave

pros:
Depending on what floor your on, their is great teamwork.
You will totally get paid for working more. You will learn time management skills, and have multiple opportunities for overtime
cons:
You will get dumped on if you’re a new nurse.
If you don’t speak up you can end up with a dangerous assignment. You may encounter favoritism when dealing with management so be alert.
